instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
Hello everybody, I have slightly water damaged MacBook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, all board is cleaned and all works, despite charging.

I have changed: ISL6259HRTZ and also same resistors near it.

it works from battery, for example 77%, but when charger attached, it immediately shows 100% and charging symbol, really isn't charging. Also there is no light on charger. also Mac works only from charger.

I/O  board is good, flex between audio board and main board is also good.

I need advice, how to find the cause? what signal is responsible fo battery % control?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: No green/orange light at all? Used a known good IO board and flex cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: Tested with good IO board and flex, still same, no green/orange light. Mac shows 100% and charging symbol on battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: You need a light on the charger first. Is <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: Voltage on the middle pin of the charger when plugged in? I suspect 3V42 not making it to the IO board. Inspect connector if there is no 3V on the middle pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: yes I have changed IO board and now it chargers, green-->orange light comes. voltage of battery increases.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: the problem with charging solved:) perfect! but now I can't turn on the mac, what signals should I check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: In your first post you said everything works. Disconnect battery and connect charger does it power on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: yes, it was... but it had lot corrosion on logic board, during repair process it was ultrasonically cleaned. so finally charging solved with IO. but no issue with powering on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: cooler tries to spin, but nothing more. its only charger attached, without battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: That is the usual quarter fan spin. Could be many things but the common ones are corrosion under <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>. Corroded traces/resistors in the data lines to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message:
No Title

I have changed Â±30 resistors and GonG!! Mac started :) perfect feeling... Thank You very much for help.

for future repairs:

do you prefer ultrasonic cleaning or better avoid it? I believe I have cleaned to long, about 30mins. liquid was fresh, but lot resistors damaged, I believe also intact ones became faulty.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: Holy shit 30 minutes will pretty much dissolve everything. A few minutes is enough!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: is it true if SMC ic would be failed, impossible to repair, because it is programable and nobody can't do that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charging
threads.message: Need to take an SMC from an identical donor board and reball it.
